results.title: Simvastatin reduces endothelial activation and damage but is partially ineffective in inducing endothelial repair in systemic sclerosis.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ results in rapid and significant improvement of measures of endothelial activation, suggesting a potential role of statins in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016491 @@@peripheral vascular disease@@@ in @DISEASE_Scleroderma_Systemic @DISEASE_MESH:D012595 @@@SSc@@@.

citations.NLM: Del Papa N, Cortiana M, Vitali C, Silvestris I, Maglione W, Comina DP, Lucchi T, Cortelezzi A. Simvastatin reduces endothelial activation and damage but is partially ineffective in inducing endothelial repair in systemic sclerosis. J Rheumatol. 2008 Jul;35(7):1323-8. PMID: 18528965

results.title: Randomized trial of the effects of cholesterol-lowering with simvastatin on peripheral vascular and other major vascular outcomes in 20,536 people with peripheral arterial disease and other high-risk conditions.
results.text_hl: Overall, among all participants, there was a 16% (5-25) relative reduction in the rate of first @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Vascular_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016491 @@@peripheral vascular event@@@ following randomisation (479 [4.7%] @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ vs 561 [5.5%] placebo), largely irrespective of baseline LDL cholesterol and other factors.

citations.NLM: Heart Protection Study Collaborative Group. Randomized trial of the effects of cholesterol-lowering with simvastatin on peripheral vascular and other major vascular outcomes in 20,536 people with peripheral arterial disease and other high-risk conditions.
